Docs.param: to include the discriminator, to not include the discriminator, to revert to the default setting.
Docs.summary: Includes the discriminator value of the entity type in the JSON "id" value. This was the default behavior before EF Core 9.
Docs.returns: The same builder instance so that multiple calls can be chained.
Docs.remarks: See Modeling entity types and relationships, and Accessing Azure Cosmos DB with EF Core for more information and examples.

MemberSignature.Value: public static Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.ModelBuilder HasRootDiscriminatorInJsonId (this Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.ModelBuilder modelBuilder, bool? includeDiscriminator = True);

.method public static hidebysig class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.ModelBuilder HasRootDiscriminatorInJsonId(class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.ModelBuilder modelBuilder, valuetype System.Nullable`1<bool> includeDiscriminator) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function HasRootDiscriminatorInJsonId (modelBuilder As ModelBuilder, Optional includeDiscriminator As Nullable(Of Boolean) = True) As ModelBuilder
static member HasRootDiscriminatorInJsonId : Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.ModelBuilder * Nullable<bool> -> Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.ModelBuilder

Docs.param: to include the discriminator, to not include the discriminator, to revert to the default setting.
Docs.summary: Includes the discriminator value of the root entity type in the JSON "id" value. This allows types with the same primary key to be saved in the same container, while still allowing "ReadItem" to be used for lookups of an unknown type.
Docs.returns: The same builder instance so that multiple calls can be chained.
Docs.remarks: See Modeling entity types and relationships, and Accessing Azure Cosmos DB with EF Core for more information and examples.

static member HasShadowIds : Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.ModelBuilder * Nullable<bool> -> Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.ModelBuilder

Docs.param: to force __id creation, to not force __id creation, to revert to the default setting.
Docs.summary: Forces model building to always create a "__id" shadow property mapped to the JSON "id". This was the default behavior before EF Core 9.0.
Docs.remarks: See Modeling entity types and relationships, and Accessing Azure Cosmos DB with EF Core for more information and examples.
